class_notes: This course will examine how modern German literature, along with modern ideas of romantic love and individuality, developed out of the medieval genre of romance, with its tales of heroism, daring adventures, and love. Readings will primarily be chapters and short excerpts from longer narrative works (romances and novels), as well as poems and a complete novella.
course_description: Fall. The first part of the GER 301-302 sequence, focusing on the changing portrayal of love in German cultural narratives (prose, drama, essays, poetry, film). The course introduces students to reading and discussing literary texts in German and is designed to foster academic writing in German.
